subject: Leadership
title: Building and Breaking Trust
description: Learn Building and Breaking Trust in one minute.

hook.text: Trust takes years to build and seconds to destroy. And the rebuilding? It takes even longer than the first time.

buildup.text: Mayer's trust model: ability, benevolence, integrity. People trust leaders who are competent, caring, and consistent.

discovery.text: Integrity-based trust is the stickiest. Competence failures are forgiven faster than character failures.

twist.text: Trust is asymmetric. One betrayal outweighs dozens of honest acts. The brain remembers threats more than rewards.

climax.text: Make small promises and keep every one. Admit mistakes fast. Be predictable in your principles, not just your moods.

punchline.text: Trust is built in drops and lost in buckets.

quiz.question: Which type of trust failure is hardest to recover from?
